Title: Manufacturing Engineer - Sainte-Claire, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job available at Soucy Belgen – Sainte-Claire
WHAT TO EXPECT
The Manufacturing Engineer: a key player in our team!
Your main mandate will be to ensure the continuous improvement of production processes. You will be involved in OHS risk reduction activities and the integration of new products. You will be responsible for the monitoring and reporting of environmental activities. You will participate in the implementation of tools and processes supporting Industry 4.0 concepts.
Here's an overview of your tasks:
Manage projects to improve the foundry's equipment and processes
Participate in the robotization of part finishing
Manage projects to improve the environmental footprint and make regulatory declarations related to incidents, greenhouse gases, dust, contaminants and noise
Perform design and drafting of mechanical parts and assemblies
Performs failure analysis in order to make recommendations to increase equipment reliability
Analyze processes to increase their efficiency and reliability
Manage and plan the implementation of new machinery
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Bachelor's degree in automation engineering or mechanical engineering
Minimum of 2 to 5 years of relevant experience
Member of the OIQ
Strong project management skills
Use of CAD software
Knowledge in hydraulics, pneumatics, automation
Fluency in French and very good knowledge of English
An organized, self-starter who is a good team player
HAT WE HAVE TO OFFER
Permanent full-time position
Multidisciplinary work team: metallurgy engineer, automation technician, cpi in computer engineering and mechanical engineer
The best of both worlds: the resources of a large company in a family atmosphere
A team that is passionate, attentive and committed to excellence
Work in a technically advanced foundry
Group insurance (different plans adapted to your needs)
Registered Retirement Savings Plan with employer contribution
Employee and family assistance program
Social activities
APPLY NOW!
Looking forward to know you and welcome you to the big Soucy family!

Title: Process Engineer - Markham, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
What we offer?
Are you curious? Come challenge yourself, innovate and learn in your everyday work - supported by an exceptionally talented Team. Join our journey. Mobility is changing - and Veoneer is a part of driving this change towards safe mobility solutions.
You will have access to exciting and emerging technologies. We focus on your professional and technical growth within advanced driving assistance systems (ADAS), collaborative and autonomous driving. We empower our teams to move technology forward in this fast-paced and challenging industry.
Are you ready to contribute to this change? Veoneer has around 9,000 purpose-driven employees in 13 countries around the world. Come join Veoneer as we lead the way in Creating Trust in Mobility.
What you'll do?
Act as a process lead for one or more assembly lines with responsibility for equipment performance/efficiency.
Investigate and implement controls and mechanical continuous improvement actions to improve process performance, quality and safety.
Investigate and resolve internal and external quality issues using various problem-solving methods.
Interface with Design Engineering, Quality, Logistics, Test Engineering and Surface Mount Technology (SMT) engineering departments.
What you'll bring?
Mechanical or Electrical Engineering Degree.
1-3 years of experience in manufacturing.
Experience with Poke Yokes, Process Failure Mode Effects Analysis (PFMEA), Machinery Failure Mode Effects Analysis (MFMEA), and Statistical Analysis.
Strong project management, interpersonal, written and verbal communications skills.
Automated Assembly Systems experience, including Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) and PC Controls programming.
Mechanical design experience using Solidworks or AutoCAD is preferred.
Experience with OMRON, Beckhoff and/or Visual Basic would be an asset.
A candidate who possesses an electronics manufacturing background would be an asset.
We thank all applicants for their interest. Veoneer is an equal opportunity employer and
is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Accommodations may be made available upon request from candidates throughout the hiring process.

Title: Biomedical Algorithms Engineer - Burnaby, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
By joining the Kardium team, you can help make a difference in the lives of millions around the world. Kardium is developing a ground breaking medical device for the minimally-invasive diagnosis and treatment of atrial fibrillation, a heart condition that can cause strokes, heart failure, and other heart-related complications.
As our Biomedical Algorithms Engineer, you will join Kardium’s Cardiac Mapping Team in designing, developing, and evaluating algorithms to turn raw data into actionable information for physicians. You will support the development of 3-dimensional maps used by electrophysiologists during cardiac ablation procedures, using a wealth of electrical, anatomical, and spatial information as inputs. You would have the opportunity to bring your creative and innovative ideas to help Kardium achieve its goal of helping improve people’s lives.
What you’ll do…
Apply scientific investigation methods to drive product innovations in mapping and navigation algorithms.
Design, implement, and evaluate algorithmic approaches to meet clinical needs related to navigation, electrophysiology, and ablation
Systematically analyze large multivariate data sets of electrophysiological, anatomical, spatial, and procedural data
Act as an independent problem-solver, finding ways to connect customer-facing deliverables to appropriate technical problem statements and solutions
Design experiments to evaluate the performance of new algorithms
Supplement algorithmic analysis with occasional hands-on, benchtop data collection
Advance Kardium’s intellectual property by contributing to our patent portfolio
Communicate experiments, analyses, and results to teammates and senior leadership
What you bring to the team…
Our Kardium team is smart, creative, and passionate about creating cutting-edge medical devices to help improve people’s lives. We work within a collaborative environment based on trust and respect. And we understand that only by working together can we solve the unsolvable. You bring to the team these characteristics, plus:
Either a bachelor’s or a graduate degree in engineering, physics, or equivalent
Minimum 3 years of experience in research or development within a high-technology field; experience with algorithmic design preferred, experience with medical devices or equivalent an asset
Extensive experience with programming for data analysis; emphasis on MATLAB or Python; experience with object-oriented programming, source control, and Java are also assets
Strong understanding of foundational topics in applied mathematics including calculus, linear algebra, and statistics
Familiarity with a selection of advanced topics in applied mathematics that support clinical algorithm design; these topics could include:
Signal processing (e.g. Fourier analysis, FIR and IIR filters, wavelet analysis)
Three-dimensional tracking/navigation, point clouds, or computational geometry
Machine learning (e.g. regression, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction) or optimization
Multivariate statistics
Image processing, medical imaging, or computer vision
Effective written and verbal communication of technical subject matter
Knowledge of cardiac electrophysiology and/or the biophysics of ablation is an asset
Why work at Kardium?
We know you are looking for a meaningful career. We can offer you that, and more:
Every day you know you are making a difference by helping treat a condition that debilitates millions of people worldwide
A great working environment with opportunities to develop your skills and knowledge while working with cutting-edge technology
An engaged leadership team who believes in mentoring and growing employees’ careers
Supportive colleagues and plenty of fun social events to encourage employee interactions
And our employees think we are great too – check out Glassdoor to learn more!
How to apply…
Apply today by sending your résumé and cover letter to jobs@kardium.com, with the job title “311 Biomedical Algorithms Engineer” in the subject line.
The job posting will remain open until filled.
Thank you in advance for your interest in working at Kardium!
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Product Engineer - Bradford, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Overview:
Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 13th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in “Automotive News.” A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.
Scope of the Position:
The Product Engineer reports to the Product Engineering Manager. He/She must have the ability to manage multiple projects/tasks from the concept to production and during the production life of the product.
Responsibilities:
Prepare engineering drawings, schematics and/or prototypes based upon pre-defined product requirements.
Analyse current product offerings to determine ways to improve quality, increase functionality, maintain aesthetic appeal and reduce cost of production.
Consider environmental/social impact of product design, manufacture and disposal.
Analyse and reverse-engineer competitor product offerings.
Identify key product strengths and weaknesses.
Develop solutions to product weaknesses.
Test physical and computerized drawings and prototypes for functionality, reliability and ease of manufacture.
Assist the product development team with keeping development on schedule.
Ensure all products meet or exceed applicable safety standards.
Research components, part suppliers and materials for suitability, durability and cost-effectiveness.
Prepare detailed product development reports at each stage of the development process.
Liaise with sales and manufacturing departments to ensure that product specifications align with corporate strategy and competitive goals.
Respond to product development/functionality inquiries.
Assist with the development of detailed product manufacturing instructions, schematic drawings and training materials for manufacturing, sales and use of products.
Oversee the testing and analysis of materials.
Stay current with industry trends as well as product development and sales methodologies.
Assist the sales and marketing staff with understanding the functionality and benefits of products.
Observe product related policies and procedures.
Assist the product development team with keeping within product development budgets.
Observe key product development cycles.
Troubleshoot product malfunctions/failures to prevent future concerns.
Maintain accurate product development records.
Qualifications:
Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering
5+ years' experience
Good analytical capabilities
Mechanically inclined
Problem solving and decision making
Ability to work with minimal supervison
Ability to travel to USA and international destinations
Cando attitude
Ability to manage multiple projects/tasks
Good presentation skills
Ability to complete VA/VE and Product R&D activities
Practies good customer service
Benefits:
Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
RRSP retirement savings plan
Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
Paid holidays and vacation time
What do our employees have to say?
“It engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.”
“Lots of growth opportunity.”
“The company’s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.”
Not just a job—a great place to work!
Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer. Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

Title: Junior/Intermediate Transportation Engineer/Technician - Canada - Indeed.com
Manufacturing Engineer - Pointe-Claire, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Careers that Change Lives
Engineers are indispensable to achieving our Mission. That’s why we empower you to bring the best of your experience to bear on our market-leading portfolio of innovations. Apply your existing skills and develop new ones, with the training, mentorship and the guidance you need to continue to develop your expertise. With roles in specific business units, as well as at the corporate level, you’re sure to find an opportunity to make an impact that’s right for you.
Today, we’re partnering across the industry to confront systemic healthcare challenges – this requires bold leadership. If you want a challenging, energizing, rewarding career that changes lives, join us. Help us bring the next generation of life-changing medical technology to patients worldwide.
A Day in the Life
Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned.
Designs manufacturing processes, procedures and production layouts for assemblies, equipment installation, processing, machining and material handling.
Designs arrangement of machines within plant facilities to ensure most efficient and productive layout.
Designs sequence of operations and specifies procedures for the fabrication of tools and equipment and other functions that affect product performance.
Adapts machine or equipment design to factory and production conditions.
May incorporate inspection and test requirements into the production plan.
Inspects performance of machinery, equipment, and tools to verify their efficiency, and investigates and initiates corrective action of problems and deficiencies to ensure product quality.
Develops manufacturing processes that are applicable to statistical process control, and may develop those techniques.
Provides guidance to engineering regarding design concepts and specification requirements to best utilize equipment and manufacturing techniques.
Ensures processes and procedures are in compliance with regulations.
Lead/participate in cross-functional projects for yield, cost and quality improvments from project initiation to implementation
Facilitate/Lead implementation of changes to manufacturing, processes. Follow-yp through completion and ensure meet expectations for cost quality and service
Lead/participate in improvement projects and workshops
Minimum Requirements
Bachelors degree required
Good knowledge of French and English is required
Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience in Engineering and Manufacturing, or advanced degree with 0 years of experience
Nice to Have
Problem solving skills
Project Management skills
Experience in Lean Six Sigma
Experience in Manufacturing Engineering
Experience in interacting with cross funtional teams of Direct labor
About Medtronic
Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.
We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.
Physical Job Requirements
The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role.

Title: Junior Hardware Engineer - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Nymi is a world where people and digital systems converge with privacy by design, unmatched security, and a natural UX, even in the most challenging work environments. We create a digital twin for the connected worker through a hands-free, continuous, private, and secure link to the digital world.
We're looking for a talented and motivated junior hardware engineer to join the Hardware and Manufacturing team. This full-time position will focus on troubleshooting and analysis of current production designs and support development of next generation hardware products from prototype to mass production. We’re looking for a highly motivated individual who is a professional, detail-oriented, team player interested in working in a fast-paced environment. Working remotely from home is possible some of the time, but this position requires regular access to Nymi’s head office in the heart of downtown Toronto.
Please include a separate cover letter in your submission.
What you'll be doing:
Supporting root cause analysis of hardware failures on our current generation products
Troubleshooting defects at the manufacturing level to drive a reduction in reject rates
Fabricating and bringing up of engineering proof-of-concepts for our next generation technology
Providing hardware tracking, troubleshooting and debugging support internal to the company
Electrical circuit board (PCB) design to support the product development team
Firmware and script development to support manufacturing and test activities
Providing detailed analysis of current designs, leading to improvements and cost reduction opportunities of future implementations
What you bring to the table:
BS degree in electrical engineering, mechatronics, or equivalent
Experience working with mixed-signal electronic circuits, diagnostic tools and benchtop test equipment
Experience troubleshooting hardware and reworking densely populated circuit boards
Comfortable with surface mount soldering and rework equipment
Working knowledge of C programming and microcontroller based designs
Ability to perform thorough root cause analysis of hardware failures and report results with detailed supporting evidence
Experience working with wearable/mobile electronics and familiarity with RF an asset
What you'll learn with us:
Hardware design and development lifecycle
Firmware programming (embedded C) and scripting (Python)
Quality management in manufacturing according to ASQ standards
Micro BGA and SMD soldering techniques using specialized equipment
Product certification and compliance practices
Project management tools and techniques
Analysis of manufacturing data including statistical and probabilistic methods
Testing and Validation techniques
Path to P. Eng designation
What's it like to work at Nymi?
We are evolving how the world’s largest organizations integrate technologies and people in a groundbreaking way. Delivering this vision goes beyond any one role, team or department; we are Nymians and as such are customer-driven, empowered, innovative, team-oriented, biased to action. We take risks, solve problems, and get stuff done.
At Nymi we embrace diversity and build teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Our commitment to being a positive and inclusive work environment goes to the core of our values. If you’re wondering whether we’re serious about this, we’re recognized as one of the Best Workplaces in Canada in 2019. We believe this is a key factor in our success and we encourage applications from tech’s under-represented groups.
Some other perks include: a great downtown location of our Toronto office (when things open up again) - transit reimbursement - education allowance - generous vacation - great benefits, incl. vision coverage - casual dress – tons of flexibility - remote work - dog friendly office ...
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Quality Engineer - Calgary, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.
Job Description & Responsibilities
EVRAZ is hiring a Quality Engineer to join our Calgary quality team. The Quality Engineer will resolve process and product quality problems to prevent re-occurrence and to facilitate the management of customer complaints through effective internal and customer communication. The Quality Engineer will also work on day to day quality management improvements and coordinate with the divisional team on broader issues.
Produce product certificates for customer orders
Setup Quality Control testing plans for customer orders
Conduct process capability analyses to evaluate pipe performance compared to customer requirements
Conduct and coordinate product and process analyses to synthesize complex technical information into meaningful conclusions and prepare comprehensive reports related to improvement initiatives
Manage on-site customer quality complaints and the communication with the customer and the company sales and technical teams
Perform periodic process audits to ensure conformance with documented work procedures as well as, participate in Tubular Product Group internal and external quality audit functions
Monitor and trend daily/weekly key quality metrics and communicate issues to mill management as part of effort to identify improvement opportunities
Assist in the administration and improvement of the quality system to maintain compliance with quality standards
Requirements
University Engineering degree, preference for candidates with Metallurgical/Materials or Mechanical disciplines
2-5 years of quality experience in a manufacturing environment
Experience facilitating and solving quality problems including, 8D with Root Cause Analysis, bringing in ideas and buy-in from interdepartmental groups
Experience developing, reporting and presenting ideas and projects to various levels of management and customers
Demonstrated experience working with customers, inspectors, bargaining unit members and management staff within a production environment
Positive attitude and open to new ideas to accomplish tasks
Strong attention to detail
Good communication, time management and report writing skills
Good knowledge of steel processes and tubular products
Experience with statistical data analysis and process analysis
Trained and certified in quality auditing
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of programs
Mechanical, metallographic or chemical testing lab experience, an asset
Six-sigma green belt or better qualifications, an asset
Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!
Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
Short and long term disability programs
Competitive retirement plans
Paid vacations and statutory holidays
Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
Tuition reimbursement
All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.
While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.
Equal Opportunity Employer
EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.
EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.
If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail careers@evrazna.com or call:
(312) 533-3577
. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.
Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

Title: Engineer - FTTH Fibre Optics and Distribution Networks - Longueuil, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Welcome to a place where people are at the heart of everything we do.
Welcome to people who like people, to brilliant minds, tomorrow’s visionaries, challenge seekers, collaborators, and those with an entrepreneurial spirit in their DNA.
At CIMA+ you’ll find a place where everyone’s ideas and perspectives are welcomed and encouraged, a place where you’ll have many opportunities to learn and develop while working on projects that rally our team together, where you can proudly become a company shareholder.
At CIMA+, we give you the freedom and flexibility to manage your work on your own terms and define what work-life balance means to you.
At the end of the day, we’re proud to be able to say that when you join CIMA+, we’ll welcome you into a place that you can call home.
Mission
CIMA+ is looking for a civil engineer to join its FTTH telecommunication team in our Communication Systems Department.
The team dedicated to FTTH telecommunications and distribution networks provides engineering services primarily to municipal clients (regional county municipalities) wishing to offer high-speed internet to their citizens who do not already have access to this service.
The incumbent will support the team by reviewing load calculations and designing the fibre optics supporting structural network (poles). They will also be responsible for preparing construction drawings for works required on the public utilities network.
They will also occasionally be required to support the Energy team in the design of overhead and underground distribution networks.
Primary Responsibilities
Design and verify load calculations for supporting structures (poles).
Support the team in the preparation of drawings, and the follow-up of approval requests for completed work on the distribution network with public entities and utilities.
Support team members in solving technical problems.
Provide technical guidance to team members.
Carry out field surveys related to various calculation projects (if required).
Ensure the follow-up and management of calculations for various projects.
Profile
Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or an equivalent
Member of the
Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec
(OIQ)
At least 3 years of experience in the area of telecommunication or overhead/underground distribution networks
Practical knowledge of software and applications used by public utilities (SimPAS, DUSS, DUC2)
Knowledge of the SIG/SAP/AGIL software (an asset)
Excellent French communication skills (spoken and written)
Ability for teamwork, thoroughness, and leadership
Ethics and integrity are fundamental values at CIMA+, and we are looking for people who uphold these principles. We are committed to creating opportunities for all our talents to contribute to the firm’s success, develop and grow, regardless of cultural or other differences. We fully endorse employment equity principles and encourage women, visible minorities, indigenous people, and individuals with disabilities to apply for any position offered at CIMA+. Adaptation measures are provided upon request to facilitate participation in the recruitment process.

Title: SecDevOps Engineer - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Why join us?
Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor? If so, we would love to tell you our story.
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets. The Product & Technology team is an exciting new team focused on leveraging the newest technologies and approaches to deliver solutions & systems for the modern-day end user. Our primary focus and commitment is to provide real value and we encourage innovation and empower open-thinking for all our team members. We’re excited for the opportunity to have highly driven and impactful talent join our team!
You will be a key member of an engaged, high-reaching team—part of a world-class, winning culture that prioritizes people development and focuses on long-term growth. We take great pride in leading the industry by earning respect through every interaction, every day. We go above and beyond to protect and grow relationships by anticipating needs, being honest and considerate, and valuing customers as genuine partners.
As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Recommending automation improvements to replace manual tasks utilizing SecDevOps tooling
Configuring end user and administration access that adhere to OMERS access control guidelines
Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as code tools (Terraform, Ansible.. etc)
Use monitoring tools and system analytics to quickly diagnose the root cause analysis
Creating and maintaining operational runbooks for components, so known issues are not re-encountered by other team members
Expert in proxy servers & firewall setup and maintenance
Working experience with security tools like but not limited to Fortify, Twistlock, SonarQube, Consul, Vault
Participating in ITIL activities including change review, incident review, RCA, and problem management
Perform application penetration testing
Perform manual security code reviews
Working knowledge of Python
Hands-on experience with Networking and Security Concepts
Source code management in GitLab
Applying vendor provided system patches to DevOps tooling and Kubernetes containers
Coordinating with all teams and end users for change requests and providing regular status and schedule updates to the team
To succeed in this role, you have:
A University degree in the field of Information Technology
Experience with the following:
RHEL 6+ Linux OS and shell scripting
Workload on Google Cloud Platform
Automation tools such as Ansible for automated application builds
Monitoring tools for statistics analysis and pro-active system tuning
GitLab CI/CD pipeline design and scheduling with stages inclusive of linting, code analysis, container scanning, and testing
Authentication protocols, ACL rules, and Identity Management mechanisms such as Active Directory or Oracle Identity Access Management
DevOps Tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, Azure DevOps GIT, K8 containers, Maven , and various testing tools
Maintain local development workspace inclusive of tools such as Minicubes, Skaffold, NPM, etc
Build and Deploy Pipelines
Hands-on experience with vulnerability scanning, static & dynamic application security testing
Release management and branching techniques
YAML configuration of Kubernetes and micro service containers
Strong understanding of cyber security concepts, protocols, industry best practices, frameworks and regulations such as International Standards Organization (ISO) 2700x
Our story:
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.
OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.
Vaccination Policy
At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to be fully vaccinated or have an approved exemption before attending OMERS and Oxford premises for work or for participating in in-person work events or work meetings.

Mechanical Engineer
with a strong background in machine design. The successful candidate will work with other members of our engineering team to design and implement various elements of complex welding systems.

Development of machine design from concept to detail
Review of the design interaction with other machines and tools in a complex system
Review of design compliance to technical specifications and requirements

Dental insurance
: Coverage includes 80% of basic services (maximum $1,500 per calendar year), such as recall exams, fillings, root canal; 50% of major services (maximum $1,500 per calendar year), such as dentures, crowns; and 50% of orthodontic services (maximum $2,000 per lifetime, age 6 - 18 only).

: Long-Term Disability:
 (Mandatory) Employee pays 100% of premium. Cash benefits received are tax-free. Subject to approval of medical evidence by SunLife Financial. Coverage begins after 17 weeks of continuous sickness or disability. Benefit amount - 60% of your first $5,000 of monthly earnings, plus 40% of any excess amount, to a maximum of $6,000. Benefit period - to age 65.
 Short-Term Disability (Self-insured):
 The Company self-insures a Short-Term Disability plan for permanent employees who have completed one (1) year of employment and are unable to work due to verifiable, non-occupational medical cause. Subject to approval by a leading care management company. Benefit amount - 100% of weekly earnings for each year of completed service; 66 2/3% of weekly earnings for each week of disability thereafter. Maximum benefit period - 17 weeks.
Insurance
: Group Life Insurance:
 Coverage is 1 x annual earnings to a maximum benefit of $200,000. Extended Health coverage will continue to the spouse and eligible dependents for one (1) year.
 Dependent Life Insurance:
 Coverage is $5,000 for spouse; $2,500 each dependent child.
 Optional Life Insurance - Employee & Spouse:
 Optional (At Employee’s Expense) . Coverage available in units of $10,000 to a maximum (combined) benefit of $500,000 (for you and/or your spouse). Approved by Underwriter.
Life insurance
: Group Insurance Benefits:
 Enrolment in the Group Insurance Benefits Plan is mandatory for permanent, full-time employees upon successful completion of a three (3) or six (6) month probationary period (as stated in offer of employment contract). Liburdi pays 100% of the premiums for your extended health coverage, dental care, vision care, group life, dependent group life, and accidental death and dismemberment. Long Term Disability is the only benefit which is not funded by the Company so that disability payments you receive will be non-taxable.
Medical and paramedical expenses coverage
: Extended Health Coverage:
 Coverage includes 80% (lowest cost generic drugs available); semi-private room accommodation; private duty nursing; paramedical services (including chiropractor, podiatrist, etc.); orthotics, vision care, eye exams and other medical services. Annual and per visit maximums apply. Global Medical Assistance coverage.
Pension plan
: Group Retirement Savings Plan (RSP):
 A professionally managed, self directed retirement savings plan registered with Revenue Canada. Employee contributions are invested on a tax-deferred basis, until withdrawn. Contributions are voluntary and can begin immediately upon commencement of employment. The purchasing power of the group program means lower Investment Management Fees.
 Group Pension Plan:
 Mandatory participation after twenty-four (24) months of continuous permanent employment. Company will contribute between 1% to 2% of salary based on years of service. The Company will match employee contributions up to another 4% of salary after twenty-four (24) months of continuous permanent employment. Company contributions to the pension plan in respect of an employee become vested after two (2) years participation in the plan.
Reimbursement of tuition fees
: Educational Assistance Program:
 Pre-approved educational courses, seminars or programs; 100% is reimbursed for courses which have direct application to job/career development and 50% for courses that have limited job application. Reimbursement for course fees, registration fees, books will be made subsequent to successful completion (pass). Eligibility - six (6) months permanent employment.
Years of service recognition
:
 Service Award Program:
 Awards based on years of service are provided to all staff celebrating milestone anniversaries (10 & 25 years of service).
Equal Opportunity Employer
This employer is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Quality Engineer - Mont-royal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Our doors are open – to you. We are one of the Top 3 companies in our industry and globally leading in smart and secure access solutions. As a trusted partner, we stand for innovation, top performance and a fulfilling workplace. Join our team of 15,000 colleagues around the world and help us build trust every day.
Quality Engineer
Montreal, CA, QC H4P 2G7
Nov 9, 2021
dormakaba: ranked in the top 100 global tech leaders by Thomson Reuters!
https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/products-services/technology/top-100.html
Company
The dormakaba Group is one of the top three companies in the global market for access and security solutions. The company is a single source provider of products, solutions and services related to doors and secure access to buildings and rooms. No matter where you are, if you need reliable and innovative access and security solutions, we will provide you high quality service – in hotels, shops, sports facilities, airports, hospitals, at home or in the office. Around the globe.
With over 16,000 employees worldwide (over 500 in Montreal), dormakaba is present in over 130 countries and has more than 150 years of experience. The dormakaba Group is headquartered in Rümlang, Switzerland, and generates annual revenues of over 3 billion dollars CAD.
dormakaba offers you a career not a job. Join us now and make a real difference in creating the next generation of products and services. Visit our website www.dormakaba.com
The Quality Engineer is responsible to measure all activities from Quality Control. Furthermore, in line with Continuous Improvement philosophy, to put in place, maintain and facilitate the inspection process.
Under the authority of KIM Site Senior Manager, Quality and Repair Service, the Quality Engineer is responsible to measure all activities from Quality Control. Furthermore, in line with Continuous Improvement philosophy, to put in place, maintain and facilitate the inspection process.
Accountable for periodic reports covering supplier quality and delivery performance as well as summary of NCR/CA activities and on-going improvement activities.
Responsibilities
Follow & build reports on all NCR’s & CAR’s
Ensure consistent implementation of ECN’s
Create / Maintain Inspection sheet (Control Plans)
Measure & follow key indicators (KPI’s)
Suggest improvements that will help the department reach its goals.
Support in managing TQM module in AX 2009
Manage the Quarantine & Conduct MRB meetings
Make SPC analysis on chosen parts, including tooled or assembled parts.
Make Internal Audits on Processes and finished goods
Analyze and solve problem using lean tools
All other tasks related to the position.
Requirements
Engineer (Mec., Indus., others)
Fully bilingual (French, English / spoken – written)
At least 2 years of experience in a manufacturing environment
Solid skills in metrology, geometrical tolerances & CMM applications.
Experience on MRP software
Experience in ISO-9001 environment
Skills in statistical process control
Solid knowledge base on MS Office / Excel.
Specific competencies required
Capacity to Discern & Decide
Communication skills, listening ear
Changing agent, facilitator
Positive retroaction on people / processes
Good organization & analysis skills
Multitasking ability.
We offer
A fast-growing international company
A stimulating, fast and friendly work environment
An opportunity to highly contribute to the success of the company
Competitive global compensation
Free parking and on-site cafeteria
A 3-minute walk from Namur metro station.
dormakaba Canada Inc.
